alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 7:00PM MST until August 22 at 8:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of north central Arizona, including the following county, Coconino. * WHEN...Until 845 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Avoid the Tusayan area where standing and flowing water continues to impact roadways and properties. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 646 PM MST, Coconino County officials reported widespread flooding in Tusayan. Highway 64 in Tusayan remained closed at 6:45 pm MST. Flooding is ongoing. A few thunderstorms will brush areas east of Tusayan between 7 and 8 pm MST with only brief light to moderate showers. Nothing like earlier this afternoon. - Tusayan is the most likely place to experience flooding. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Colorado River, Little Red Horse Wash, Pipe Creek, Cremation Creek, Grapevine Creek, Bright Angel Wash, Garden Creek, Coconino Wash and Cottonwood Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mainly Tusayan - This includes State Route 64 between mile markers 227 and 237. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well.
